alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 12:28PM CST until January 27 at 4:10AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Sulphur River Near Talco affecting Franklin, Morris, Titus and Red River Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Franklin, Morris and Titus Counties. For the White Oak Creek...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Sulphur River near Talco. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of the heavily wooded floodplain. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the river bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM CST Friday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.0 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.5 feet on 10/25/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued late tonight at 415 AM CST.
